front.title: Listing of RPKI ROAs in JSON format (LORRI)

abstract.t: This document describes a commonly used JSON datastructure for RPKI Validated ROA Payload data. This specific datastructure is commonly used in the transport pipeline between RPKI Cache Validators and BGP routers.

note.title: Requirements Language
note.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: This document defines a base JSON data structure for RPKI, Validated ROA Prefix (VRP) information. Such export functionality has emerged in several implementations of relaying party (RP) software, but was not previously standardized, resulting in loose coordination between implementers. This module establishes a simple and consistent interface for information export by RPs drawing from best practices observed in existing implementations.

section.title: Export Model Design and Structure
section.t: This section should explain why the specific elements have been chosen for export, and why the structure of roas block + prefix and AS content is the most useful or widely used.

section.title: Use of JSON
section.t: LORRI files are specified in JSON format. JSON members that are not defined here MUST NOT be used in LORRI files. An RTR server MUST consider any deviations from the specifications to be errors. Future additions to the specifications in this document MUST use an incremented value for the "LorriVersion" member.
